subsection_content:
Unsafe sex is the main cause of Chlamydia transmission. A person with Chlamydia can spread the disease to his or her sexual partner through anal, oral, or vaginal sex.
The more sexual partners, the higher the risk of infection. Besides, Chlamydia can be transmitted from mother to child through the placenta or by sharing sex toys with an infected person.
subsection_title: benh chlamydia.json. How is Chlamydia transmitted?
subsection_data:
benh chlamydia.json. How is Chlamydia transmitted?
Unsafe sex is the main cause of Chlamydia transmission. A person with Chlamydia can spread the disease to his or her sexual partner through anal, oral, or vaginal sex.
The more sexual partners, the higher the risk of infection. Besides, Chlamydia can be transmitted from mother to child through the placenta or by sharing sex toys with an infected person.
